page.title: 12Michelham Priory.
page.content: Michelham Priory was built in 1229 by Gilbert de Aquila,a Norman lord who obtained permission from King Henry V111 to found an Augustinian monastery During the Peasants Revolt of 1381,the gatehouse and drawbridge were built to ward off attacks.About 1400 the great moat was dug within an existing bend of the River Cuckmere.Henry V111 dissolved the monastery in 1536 and most of its silver,ornaments etc.were sold off.Michelham then passed through a great many hands until Mr.Wright purchased it in 1923.He completely restored it but unfortunately a very bad fire damaged the Tudor wing in 1927.During the war Michelham was occupied by the army and many high level conferences took place concerning "D"day.The Priory is now owned by the Sussex Archaeological trust who open it to the public
